hero.heading: What We Stand For
hero.description: Delaware DSA is committed to creating a society built on compassion and equity rather than greed and oppression. We believe in a just world based on popular control of resources and production, equitable distribution, and a dignified life for every person.

corePrinciplesSection.title: Our Core Principles
corePrinciplesSection.subtitle: From our chapter bylaws - the foundational commitments that guide our work

principles.title: Rejection of Capitalist Economic Order
principles.description: We oppose an economic system driven solely by private profit, alienated labor, entrenched wealth, and power disparities based on race, gender, disability, or sexual orientation.

principles.title: A New Delaware Way
principles.description: We envision a humane social order rooted in democratic socialism where popular control of resources, production, and economic planning replaces corporate power and inequality.

principles.title: Freedom of Organization
principles.description: We support independent trade unions, women's rights groups, political parties, and other formations as safeguards against an intrusive state, while respecting diverse political tendencies and religious beliefs.

strategicGoalsSection.title: Our Strategic Goals
strategicGoalsSection.subtitle: Three clear objectives that guide our chapter's long-term organizing strategy

goals.title: Build a Recognizable Socialist Presence
goals.description: Establish a visible, influential socialist presence within Delaware's broader democratic left coalition.

goals.title: Dismantle Delaware's Corporate Haven Status
goals.description: Challenge and work to dismantle Delaware's corporate haven structures—including the Chancery Court—that perpetuate economic inequality and corporate dominance.

goals.title: Create a Majority Movement
goals.description: Foster a movement capable of realizing democratic socialism at both state and national levels by raising awareness of the conflict between corporate power and people's interests.

democraticStructureSection.title: How We Govern Ourselves
democraticStructureSection.subtitle: Democratic accountability through elected leadership and member participation

structure.title: General Membership
structure.description: All dues-paying members have voting rights at general meetings and elect officers through democratic process.

structure.title: Elected Officers
structure.description: Co-chairs, Secretary, Treasurer, and Membership Coordinator serve one-year terms with diversity requirements.

structure.title: Branch Representation
structure.description: Northern Branch (New Castle County) and Southern Branch (Kent & Sussex Counties) each elect representatives to the Steering Committee.

organizationSection.title: How We Organize
organizationSection.subtitle: Democratic participation through committees, working groups, and campaigns

organizationTypes.title: Standing Committees
organizationTypes.description: Ongoing organizational functions with elected co-chairs and guaranteed resources.

organizationTypes.title: Working Groups
organizationTypes.description: Issue-based and identity-based organizing around specific campaigns and communities.

organizationSection.participationInfo: All members can join committees and working groups. Leadership positions are democratically elected with term limits to ensure accountability and fresh perspectives.

aboutSection.title: Who We Are
aboutSection.content: Delaware DSA is a local chapter of the Democratic Socialists of America, the largest socialist organization in the United States with over 92,000 members and chapters in all 50 states. We became an official chapter in 2021 and represent all three counties in Delaware: Kent, New Castle and Sussex.

beliefs.title: Our Beliefs
beliefs.subtitle: We are socialists because we believe in justice. We are democratic because transformation must come from the bottom up.

principles.title: Popular Control
principles.description: We believe in democratic control of resources and production by working people, not corporate elites.

principles.title: Equitable Distribution
principles.description: Resources should be distributed based on human need, ensuring everyone has access to a dignified life.

principles.title: Bottom-Up Change
principles.description: Real transformation happens when millions of working-class people stand together, not through elite politics.

principles.title: Democratic Organization
principles.description: We are a member-funded, member-run organization that fights for reforms empowering working people.

platform.title: Delaware DSA Platform
platform.subtitle: Our core platform planks guide all our work toward justice

planks.title: Abolition of the Carceral State
planks.description: We work to dismantle the prison-industrial complex, end mass incarceration, defund police, abolish bail, and create community-based alternatives to punishment that address root causes of harm.

planks.title: Green New Deal
planks.description: We fight for massive public investment in renewable energy, sustainable infrastructure, and good union jobs to address the climate crisis while ensuring a just transition for workers.

planks.title: Housing for All
planks.description: Housing is a human right. We organize for tenant protections, rent control, social housing, and an end to homelessness through comprehensive housing justice policies.

planks.title: Health Justice
planks.description: Healthcare is a human right. We advocate for Medicare for All, mental health resources, reproductive justice, and addressing health disparities in our communities.
